column1: first-ball drop! Put down by Azhar Ali at second slip. Particularly difficult chance. He dives full-length to his wrong side - his left - and the ball does not stick. Swing for Amir right away. Full awayswinger, starts outside off, and curls away further. Warner has a bigger swing at it. Slashes hard and sends an outside edge. Azhar dives to his left, attempts the catch with both hands, but it pops out
good length and holds its line outside off, left alone
length ball, angled in, and then shapes away. Head has a crease-bound waft and watches the ball pass the outside edge
beaten again! Good length, angled in, and the late swing takes the ball away from the left-hander. He pokes, playing for the angle, and misses
length and outside off, guided towards point with soft hands
Amir shortens his length outside off, not much lateral movement. Head tightens up and leaves. Excellent over first-up from Amir
full and angled in on off, Warner is on the move as he pushes towards mid-off.
Warner shimmies out, Junaid shortens his length on and around off stump. Hint of inswing for Junaid. Warner drops it in front of midwicket and hares across for the single
full and moving away slightly, jabbed square on the off side off a thick outside edge
Head gets off the mark after seven balls. Veering onto the hips, picked away through square leg for a single
one-bounce four. First boundary of the day. Warner steps out, Junaid drops it shorter. Warner picks it up and whips it in the air with the incoming angle over midwicket
full and outside off, slices an outside edge down to third man
Warner uses his feet again, but is opened up by the awayswinger. Amir snatches the outside edge, which flies away past the slips and streaks away to third man
good length and outside off, Head covers his off stump and shoulders arms

length ball again, much wider outside off, Head continues to live dangerously. Full, starts outside off, and nibbles away further. Head is stapled to the crease as he throws his bat at the ball and does not make contact
length and outside off, hint of extra bounce, Head rides it and glides a single in the direction of third man
full, angled in, pitches on middle and leg and then swerves away past the outside edge, having opened 'em up again. Ripping delivery. Probably too good to even claim the outside edge
full and on middle and leg, no swing this time, Warner knocks it towards midwicket

Warner drives it straight of mid-off. Wahab flings himself to his left, stops the ball. Excellent effort, should lift Pakistan in the field. Slightly overpitched and outside off, smoothly driven on the front foot
length ball on off played back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, slashed away to third man via a thick outside edge
just short of a good length and outside off, Warner goes hard on a cut and ends up jabbing the ball towards cover
good length on off, nibbles away, Head inches forward and pokes a single into the covers
and the new bat brings up a boundary right away. Shot. This was overpitched on the stumps, though, Warner eases forward and drills the ball straight of mid-on with great authority
outswinger, full, starts outside off and moves away. Head leaves it be
jabbing drive, pierces the off-side field. Nice and full outside off, strong stride from Head. Meets the pitch and hits it  past extra cover
full and straight in line, shuffles across and flicks it away to the left of midwicket, where Hafeez puts in a dive and half-stops the ball, parrying it towards mid-on
back of a length and angled in, 142.5ks, picked from off stump and dragged away off the inside half past the left of Hasan Ali at mid-on
good length and angled in, looks like Amir is getting close to the stumps than he did the previous ODIs, at least in the opening burst. Knocked away to midwicket
Pitched up and just outside off, nibbles away a touch. Warner has a crack at it and ends up slicing it in the air over point off an outside edge as the ball plugs in the deep
short of a length and on a fourth-stump line. Head stands up tall and punches the ball back to the left-armer
short of a length and outside off, Head jumps back and cuts firmly, but can't beat backward point
back of a length and swerves into the left-hander. Head hangs back and attempts to whip it away to leg, ends up squirting an inside edge onto the thigh pad

driven on the up to the right of mid-off. Head is settling in after those early plays and misses. That the ball isn't swinging now helps Head. He leans forward to meet this very full ball and creams it away
good length and holds its line just outside off, Head ushers it through to the keeper
short of a length and outside off, Head attempts a slashing cut, can't beat point again
back of a length, pitches outside off, Amir continues to generate outswing. Jumps off his feet and plays a checked punch away from the body to cover
very full and angled into the pads, placed to the left of midwicket for two
short and straying into the pads, wrong line with fine leg inside the circle, picked away square of that fielder. Beats the man in the deep as well
good length, 144.4ks, tight line, angled in on middle. Blocked with a straight bat
length ball on off and middle, drives on the up and finds mid-off
and the fielding lapses continue to haunt Pakistan. Hasan at mid-on now fumbles, only gets a thumb to the ball . Very full and angled in on middle and leg, driven down the ground
full and wide outside off, possibly a slower one, thrashed on the up over cover
just short of a good length on middle, stands and delivers. Punched to cover
Warner shimmies out, the bowler pulls his length back outside off. Warner opens the face and tips the ball to point
just short of a good length and outside off as Warner shimmies out again. Flat-bats a pull in the air to the left of mid-on
Warner takes a step out again, meets a length ball, and twirls it into the vacant spaces at midwicket
short, the length is there for a cut, but the line is too close to off. Chopped away square on the off side

a big appeal for caught behind from Amir, umpire Fry shakes his head. Rizwan and slip weren't too keen. Pakistan challenge the on-field not-out decision. Fair ball from Amir. Dug in short on off stump, pings the shoulder, misses the bat, and lobs to a diving slip.... and Pakistan lose their review
pitched up and outside off, front-foot drive to mid-off
brute of a delivery. Inswinging yorker, Warner jams his bat down and toe-ends a single to midwicket
loose half-volley on the pads, no swing, Head flicks it handsomely square through the leg side and brings up the fifty stand
length ball, angled in, much tighter from Amir. Head plays to point, opening the bat-face
bouncer outside off, Head drops his wrists and sways his upper body out of the way
fractionally short and outside off. Warner swings hard at a pull and bottom-edges it over the stumps. The ball rolls away to the right of Rizwan
just short of a good length on middle, tip-and-run single to point. Good running

fractionally short and outside off again, this time to Head. This more a short-arm flap rather than a short-arm pull. Hit in the air over wide mid-on. Malik chases the ball hard, pulls it back in at the edge of the boundary, and tumbles over, he clutches his left wrist
Hasan goes full and outside off, Warner sinks his teeth into it and hits on the up. Clears his front leg and belts it over a leaping mid-off
Warner's front foot does not meet the pitch of this. Pitched up on off and off, he simply chips this one over mid-off. No violence here
shortish and on the hips, directed square through the leg side. Warner hustles across for the second. Looks like there's no stopping him today
hangs it up outside off, very full, played back to him
worked from off stump to midwicket on the back foot
lobbed up and angled in. Head attempts a big drive and ends up inside-edging the ball onto his front toe
full, comes in with the angle, Head plays down the wrong line and squirts an inside edge behind square
Head uses his feet, gets close enough to the pitch, and secures a single to long-on

pierces the off-side field and Warner follows his 130 at the SCG with a half-century off 34 balls. In between he was a big winner at the Allan Border awards night. He raises his bat and acknowledges the cheers. Slightly short and turns away outside off, Warner is super quick to pick the length up, rocking backing and lashing a cut past extra cover
full on the stumps, driven back to the bowler on the front foot
drop-and-run single to cover
short of a length and outside off, angled out to point
neatly clipped off the pads through square leg
short of a length and angling away outside off, whipped away to leg, this time by Head
Warner hits through the line and gets another one-bounce four. Fullish and outside off, clears his front leg and launches it over mid-off
length-ball offbreak, spins away outside off, Head aims to cut and chops it beside his toe. Nearly chopped on
tossed up outside off, whipped away with the wrists to long-on
pushed down leg, left alone, leg-side wide
flighted on middle, Head dances down the track, gets close enough to the pitch and push-drives a single down to long-on
fractionally short and outside off, Warner skips back and nails a cut.... but can't beat extra cover
short and angled in, Warner just fends down the ground. That actually reared from a back of a length
dug in short, angled in on middle, Head leaps off his feet and blunts it to cover
back of a length on off, cramps Head up for room. Played back to the bowler
short of a length and just a shade outside off, Wahab hits 140ks. Head jumps and fends it out to point
glanced off the hips to deep square leg
very full and veering into the pads, 146ks yorker, strikes the pad outside leg
Warner rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and helps himself to a single. Directed down to third man
tossed up on off, Warner presses forward and blocks it back to Hafeez
Warner steps out, Hafeez drags his length back. The batsman adjusts and pushes a single down to long-on
Head now uses his feet, takes a half-volley, and flicks it in the gap at midwicket. Runs back for the second
skidding into the pads, this is worked straight to midwicket on the back foot
Head stays leg side of this full ball and hits a wristy drive to long-off for one
short offbreak outside off, Warner moves back and flat-bats the ball away to long-off
short of a length on middle, opens the face and dabs to point
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped on the back foot to midwicket
hip-high short ball outside off, Head skips back for a pull. Drags it to midwicket
Head stands tall, meets a short ball outside off, and punches firmly to cover, where Hafeez has to deal with an awkward bounce. He fumbles and allows a single
back of a length and too close to the off stump for a dab down to third man. Beaten
floated up on an off-stump line and Head steps out to drive, hits it hard but straight back to the bowler
nice flight again, outside off. Head goes after it too hard, and drags it with a lot of bottom hand, back to the bowler
back of a length this time, goes back, makes room, and stabs into the covers
length ball, slides on towards off stump, defended into the covers
another slider, slightly fuller, defended back to the bowler
good stop, Azhar dives to his right at short midwicket and stops a powerful pull after Hafeez drops slightly short. Only one off the over, as a result
back of a length, angling into middle stump and cramping Head for room as he stays leg-side of the ball. Squeezed down to backward point
back of a length, again angling into the body. Head drops it softly into the covers to get off strike
bang. Wahab had been cramping Head for room, but now, with Warner on strike, offers up a fullish ball with plenty of width. Plays that trademark flat-bat drive between cover and mid-off
looks to pull, but this shortish ball cramps him for room, and he checks his shot and plays it a short distance into the leg side
back of a length, angling into leg stump. Warner stays leg-side of the ball and pokes into the cover point region
shortish, wide, Warner thrashes his arms through it and backward point makes a good stop, diving to his right
he's been slowing it down deliberately to Head. Does so again, Head goes back to a length ball on off stump and flat-bats to long-off
tossed up outside off and Warner brings up the 100 partnership, gets a big stretch out and slog-sweeps over the midwicket boundary
flighted ball on middle stump, gets forward to clip to midwicket
lbw shout, not too confident. Not given. Warner looks to work across the line of one that goes on with the angle from around the wicket. Definitely sliding down leg
nice change of pace, quicker and fired in at the pads. Warner misses the flick and the ball ricochets off pad into the off side. Again going down leg

down the track now, makes a bit of room, and that's a super shot. Got himself into the perfect position, put himself at the perfect distance from the pitch of the ball to be able to extend his arms fully and get the elevation to launch that over wide long-off
back of a length on middle stump, swatted to deep square leg
fullish outside off, driven to the left of deep point
bouncer outside off, too quick for Head to be able to connect with the hook

looks to go full now, possibly looking for the yorker, ends up slanting it down the leg side and Head misses the flick but gets a little tickle on it with his pad to beat the wicketkeeper diving to his right
back of a length on leg stump, pushed to mid-on with a straight bat
back of a length on middle stump, Warner steps across and clips to deep square leg
shortish, angling across into a fourth-stump line. Warner jumps to ride the bounce and steers through point
back of a length on middle stump, defended to midwicket
short on off stump, and that's smacked sweetly out of the middle of the bat, but the pull goes straight to the fielder at deep square leg and he can only get one for it

short again, Warner doesn't go hard at it, unlike Head the previous ball, waits a little longer and uses his wrists to whip it backward of square to send it scuttling away for four. The deep square leg fielder was stationed in front of square, as a leg-side sweeper

back of a length outside off, and that's poor cricket from Pakistan. Warner poked it into the cover point region, and Umar Akmal, moving to his left from point, fumbled, allowing the single, and then spun and sent an inaccurate throw at the bowler's end that sped all the way to the opposite boundary
back of a length, slanting across. May have been the slower ball, beats the bat as Head looks to run that down to third man
short, wide, Warner gets right on top of that to square-cut to the left of an immobile backward point. Went too quickly for him to even think of diving
shortish, angling into off stump, defended into the point region
once again short, a bit of width, this time he slaps it in front of square and finds the fielder sweeping on the cover point boundary

steps down the pitch and Wahab bowls a length ball outside off. Looks to slog that over the leg side, only manages to drag it along the ground to mid-on. They chance a single and get it. A direct hit from Sharjeel at the bowler's end would have had him out
tailing into the pads, flicked to the right of short fine-leg
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to deep square leg
flat, angling into the pads. Comes forward to clip to forward square leg

gone, is it? Skips down the track too early and Malik fires it in way outside off. Turns sharply too, so Rizwan had to move left to collect it before he could complete the stumping. Gives Head enough time to drag his foot back into the crease
shortish outside off, slapped to the right of sweeper cover
once again, short outside off, this time he can't beat backward point with his cut
fuller now, a little round-arm and angling into off stump, defended into the off side
another round-arm slider on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length on middle stump, worked away to deep square leg
length ball on middle stump, whipped to deep square leg
length ball outside off, gets on the front foot to push to cover
full-toss, nearly a yorker, a bit of inswing into the stumps. Warner jams down in a hurry to clip to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, Warner uses the angle to whip that to deep square leg
shot! That's full on off stump, and Head brings down a perfectly straight bat, full face showing to punch that between the non-striker and mid-on
tossed up outside off, Warner comes forward to drive through mid-off or cover, ends up a little too close to the ball and drags it  back to the bowler with a lot of bottom hand
quicker, back of a length, jabbed to point
quickish length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
down the track now and plays this quietly, clips from off stump to mid-on to get off strike
slows this down and ends up shortening his length. Rocks back to slap to the left of sweeper cover
short outside off, chopped away hard but backward point dives right to take pace off the ball, and the man at sweeper cover can run across and stop the ball well short of the boundary

and there it is! A century off 78 balls. Fullish on off stump and he plays a defensive push into the off side, not too far from the finish of Junaid's follow-through, but both he and Head take off immediately to ensure they complete the quick single with ease. This is his fastest hundred in ODIs - his previous quickest was off 92 balls
back of a length outside off, dabbed to backward point with an open bat-face
skips down the track and Junaid bowls a full one outside off. Whipped through midwicket
length ball angling into middle stump, cutting out room. Warner defends to short extra-cover
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to long-on
yorker on middle stump, stays leg-side of the ball to squeeze out a single into the point region
goes back to a length ball sliding in towards off stump, makes room, and chops it away through point. A shot you can only play on a pitch as flat and true as this
shortish, close to off stump, not enough room to cut and he can't beat the man at backward point
no room to cut this time, kept coming in with the angle, ends up bottom-edging into the pitch. Went too hard at it
shortish on middle stump, and Head brings up fifty with a bottom-handed whip-pull to the boundary to the right of deep square leg
full on leg stump, clipped to long-on

premeditated, he was in position to sweep almost before Malik delivered. He shortened his length, and Warner adjusted by whipping it in the air, a fair distance to the right of the fielder at short fine leg
fullish on off stump, driven to mid-off

shortish outside off, carved away to the right of deep point, and Junaid, sprinting across and diving, misfields at the boundary to give away four. Wanted to push that back into the field of play with his right hand, but the ball sneaked below his hand
full-toss on off stump, whipped past the bowler to mid-off
shortish on middle stump, Warner opens out to pull, and gets it to carry all the way over the square leg boundary
low full-toss on off stump, clipped to long-on
yorker on off stump, makes a bit of room to try and squeeze it through point, but it tails in just a bit, forcing him to hit it straighter, to the fielder at short cover
back of a length on middle and leg, goes on the back foot to nurdle into the square-leg region
tossed up on off stump, and that becomes leg stump as Warner turns himself around to reverse-swat it powerfully between short third man and backward point
tossed up outside off, plenty of swinging room for Warner to launch that over mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, steps back and across to work to midwicket
back of a length, angling down leg, swiped to deep backward square leg
back of a length outside off, goes on the back foot to drag his pull to square leg
yorker on middle stump, squeezed out to mid-off with a straight bat
full, wide outside off, driven to deep point
back of a length on middle stump, lets it come on and dabs into the cover point region
full-toss, reversing into the pads, Head whips it away to the forward square leg boundary
shortish, no room to pull. Was a little late on it, actually, and he ends up playing it to mid-on. Wanted to hit it through midwicket, I think
very full on middle and leg. Looks to push through mid-off, and the angle - and maybe some reverse - causes him to inside-edge into his pad
length ball angling across towards off stump, pushed towards mid-off
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to steer that to the left of third man
short, pulled from just outside off to the midwicket boundary to bring up the 200 partnership
length ball on middle stump. Stays leg-side of the ball and dabs into the point region
back of a length on middle stump, worked away through square leg
fullish on leg stump, gets his feet out of the way and defends to short midwicket
shortish outside off, chopped to the left of third man

Shortish on middle stump and Warner looks to run it down to third man. From middle stump. For once he's cramped for room and he bottom-edges into his pad and they run a quick single as it dribbles away into the off side
full on the pads, angling down leg, misses the flick and it ricochets off pad to point
back of a length, a bit of reverse in towards middle and leg. Stays leg-side of the ball again to push to backward point
slower ball outside off, lets it come and dabs to the right of backward point. Babar Azam makes a diving stop, but they manage to take a single without too much fuss
shortish outside off, slapped to backward point

back of a length on middle, Head chops the ball ball down the pitch and sets off. Head was looking for the second, but has to settle with one, as Warner loses his bat at the non-striker's end. It bounces off the turf and runs further away him
leg-side delivery, helped away fine on the leg side
full and angling away outside off, slashed away to sweeper cover

Oh dear! Warner skies one in the air, and Amir drops it. Full on the stumps, Warner aims for a leg-side mow. He can't only skew it in the air. Amir runs in from long-on, the sun squinting in his eyes, but shells it. Pops in and out. The camera pans out to coach Arthur and fielding coach Rixon in the Pakistan change room. Arthur covers his face up with his hands while Rixon shakes his head. Pakistan's fielding goof-ups continue
back of a length and outside off, steered into the covers
back of a length and outside off, punched away through the covers
yorker on middle, 150.1ks, jammed back to the bowler
slower-ball bouncer outside off, Head bails out of the hook at the last moment
short of a length and outside off, Head aims to slog it over midwicket. Ends up top-edging it in the air fine of third man
overpitched and outside off, flat-batted drive to the right of extra cover
pitched up on middle, Head stays leg-side of the ball and punches it to mid-off. Pinches a quick single
full and on leg stump, Warner now stays leg-side of the ball and chips it in the air. Well-controlled hit, scooped over wide mid-off. One-bounce four
chest-high short ball on the leg stump, Warner is unperturbed. He rocks back and hooks it over long leg. This one goes all the way
full and outside off. Flat-batted away fiercely to the right of mid-off
back of a length and on the hips, Warner camps on the back foot and clips it away through square leg
Warner deftly runs it down to third man and brings up his 150. He raises his bat and acknowledges the applause again. Is the 200 on? His third fifty has come off only 29 balls
Warner gently drops the ball to the leg side for a single
dug short and outside off, sits up to be hit. Head rocks back and pulls along the ground to deep midwicket
Warner backs away outside leg stump, Wahab spears it wide outside off, 150ks. Warner slashes but can't reach it
yorker on middle, 150.1ks, pace like fire. Warner jams his bat down in the nick of time. Squirts a bottom edge behind square on the leg side
bouncer outside off, bursts off the surface, beats the hook
yorker on the leg stump, squeezed out to midwicket, where Umar Akmal is lazy to bend down and fumbles an extra run
slower short ball outside off, waits for the ball to arrive and drags the ball to deep midwicket
very full and outside off, near yorker, front-foot drive straight to mid-off
tennis-ball bouncer outside off,  Head attempts a ramp but the ball bounces over
length and outside off, helped down to third man
Junaid digs another slower bouncer outside off, Warner jumps off his feet, upper-cuts, but the ball still sails over him to the keeper

yorker on middle, Warner stays leg-side of the ball and digs it back to the bowler's right. He fumbles, and this is now Australia's highest opening stand in ODIs, surpassing Finch and S Marsh's effort in 2013
very full on the stumps, Warner picks it up and whips it in the air just over midwicket
fractionally short and outside off, Warner short-arms it away to long-on
Head dances out, takes a half-volley and drills it down the ground. There is a misfield at long-on, but it's just two
Head moves away outside leg stump, the bowler follows him. Nicked in front of the keeper as he is cramped for room
Head walks across off, meets a full-toss, and slaps it down the ground to long-on

there it is! Slower short ball on middle, Warner waits for the ball to arrive. Then launches it into the stands beyond midwicket with a pull. This is now Australia's highest stand for any wicket in ODIs
short and slides in with the arm on middle from around the stumps, Head goes back and forces it to Hafeez
dropped short on middle, Head skips back and pulls firmly through the leg side. Deep midwicket slides to his right, just escorts the ball to the fence
length ball, looped up outside off, gets forward and drives down to long-off
Warner steps away, makes room, and cuts a short ball to sweeper cover
length-ball offbreak outside off, turns away, tapped to the off side
wide yorker outside off, Warner can't scythe it away. Beaten
very full and outside off, Warner opens the bat-face and squeezes a single down to third man
slower short ball outside off, Head reaches out, slashes and does not make contact
wide yorker, reaches out and slices the ball in the direction of point

Warner uses his feet, wide full ball outside off, Warner squeezes his bat down, but can't make contact. The ball whistles past the outside edge. Junaid appeals, thinking Warner had nicked it. The appeal is shot down quickly
Junaid persists with the wide yorker, Warner aims to reach out and carve it away. No dice. Instead he is floored
dropped short and just a shade outside off, moves back and pulls firmly to long-on
speared short on middle, goes back and flat-bats it to the bowler's right
Hafeez tosses it up full outside off, Warner reaches out his hands and smacks it over extra cover for six. He then loses his balance; he's suffering from cramps
pushed through on middle, driven down to long-off

Head removes his helmet, kisses it, and gets a hug from Warner. Soaks in his maiden ODI hundred, on his home ground. And he reaches the landmark with his favourite cut. Short and outside off, cracked away through the covers
Warner ventures to the leg side, Hafeez follows him and tucks him up. Punched down the ground for a single
full-toss outside off, Warner creams a drive to the right of sweeper cover. Skips away to the fence
wide yorker, that's very harsh on Junaid. Inside the tramline. Speared outside off, Warner can't reach out and touch it
very full and outside off, flat-batted away to cover

carved away in the air. It dies in front of point, but Azam bends forward and snaps up a low catch. He claims it, and they go upstairs. It's a clean catch and a cramping David Warner walks back for 179, his best ODI score. No double-hundred for him, though. Slower short ball, cuts away from Warner. He reaches out for the ball and scythes it in the air. The opening stand ends on 284
and he sets to work with a first-ball four. Back of a length and angling away outside off, steps back and punches it serenely through the covers

Swatted away in the air. Wahab tracks the ball from mid-on, runs to his right, and plucks the overhead catch. But on impact his right knee got jarred in the turf. He collapses and winces in pain. Banged in short and outside off head-hunting ball, too high for a hook. Smith flat-bats it in the air and holes out
yorker on the leg stump, dug back to the bowler
back of a length and on leg stump, Maxwell steps away outside leg and hits to wide long-on with a clubbing swing
Head backs away outside leg, this is a head-high bouncer outside off. Head jumps off the ground but the ball sails over him. Wide called
Head pre-meditates outside leg, Amir chases the batsman with a 142ks short ball.Head smites a six over midwicket
Head pre-mediates again, backing a long way outside leg. Amir hurls it wide outside off. Head can't reach out and flay it away. Beaten
low full toss on leg stump, scooped in front of mid-off
very full on leg stump, 144.3ks, Maxwell shovels it away to cow corner
pretty full and wide outside off, Head throws his bat at ball and slices an outside edge to third man. 300 up for the hosts
147ks full-toss on middle and leg. Head has a good ol' hack at it and drags it to midwicket off the inside half. Wahab working up serious pace, despite hurting his knee
Maxwell shuffles across off, banged in short, Maxwell half-ducks, the ball flies over him. Wide called for height

151.7ks, short and wide outside off, Maxwell, having backed away outside leg, has ample leverage to flat-bat a cut over point. Hit flat and hard for six. In the World Cup 2015 match, Maxwell unleashed the back-away-look-away cut off Wahab. This one was the back-away-look-at-the-ball cut
pinpoint yorker, dug back to the bowler
full on middle, Head backs away and lifts the ball over mid-off
yorker on middle, drilled down to mid-on
Maxwell shuffles across off stump, Wahab slips in the slower cutter at 115ks. Maxwell adjusts and helps it away fine on the leg side
nice and full outside off, Head looks to launch it downtown. Does not time it well enough, scoops the ball over Azhar at mid-off

high short ball outside off, Head has a crack at it with the pull. Skies over midwicket. Sharjeel at deep midwicket runs across to his right, puts in the dive, but the ball eludes his reach. Long-on runs to his left and mops it up
full-toss on middle and leg, Head has a swipe at it and ends up dragging the ball off the inside half to deep midwicket
full and wide outside off, 145.6ks, Maxwell, having backed away, can't put bat on ball
Maxwell hits it flat and hard to Hafeez at sweeper cover.  Full and outside off, Maxwell simply shovels it in the air with the bottom hand to the man in the deep. Dolly catch

length ball on middle and leg, clipped away to Azam at deep midwicket. Azam picks the ball up swiftly and releases it to Amir, but the bowler does not collect the ball cleanly, messing up a run-out opportunity. Head is home at the non-striker's end and Wade pockets two
full-toss on leg stump, 148.2ks, whipped away to deep square leg
wild short ball outside off, slanted away further. Wide called
low full-toss on off, Wade threads the gap between wide mid-off and extra-cover with a good-looking drive
slower short ball just outside off, legcutter, Wade bails out of the pull. Floats through to the keeper and beats Rizwan
Head backs away outside leg, takes a full ball from leg stump and hoicks it away to deep midwicket
length ball on middle and leg, driven to long-on. Wade calls for two and gets it in the end
yorker on off, 147.2ks, squeezed back to Wahab
starts off with a yorker just outside off, jabbed into the cover-point region for a single
slower ball from Hasan. Full and cuts away from the left-hander. Wade aims to loft it, possibly down the ground. Ends up slicing a catch to sweeper cover
Head puts Hasan in the stands beyond midwicket. Length ball outside off, another slower one, drops down to one knee and smites a slog-sweep

Juggles and takes it on the third attempt. Azhar has a wry smile. Head walks back for 128, acknowledging the applause at his home ground. Full and angling away outside off, Head eyes a leg-side slog, ends up skying an overhead catch to long-off. Azhar hangs onto it.... just
Faulkner steps down the track, Hasan pulls his length back outside off and beats him. The new man slashes and does not connect
very full and wide outside off, on the tramline or just inside, wide called. Faulkner can't carve it away
low full-toss on off, jabbed into the covers
short on middle and leg, cramps Faulkner for room. Dabbed towards point
dug short and outside off, dragged to midwicket off the inside half
full cutter outside off, Faulkner swings way too early and misses

slower bouncer outside off, Faulkner has a swat at it and top-edges it away to the right of deep square leg. Hafeez moves to his right, is lazy to bend down as he looks to scoop it back into the field of play. Instead, escorts the ball to the boundary
wide yorker outside off, Faulkner can't jam it out. He calls his partner through for a bye. Handscomb makes it even as Rizwan connects with the direct hit at the striker's end

slower short ball on the leg stump, Handscomb does not get enough power behind the pull. He can't manufacture his own pace. Holes out to Hafeez at deep square leg running across to his left. Wahab finishes with a wicket. He has done fairly well today even as his colleagues crashed and burned
yorker on off, Starc can only squeeze it through cover
full and outside off, Faulkner lays into it, smearing a drive wide of sweeper

yorker just outside off, Faulkner jams his bat down on it. Breaks the inside of the bat, and Faulkner needs a new one. Hasan picks the ball up in his follow-through and scoops it onto the stumps, but Faulkner is well in
yorker just outside off, angled down to third man
full on the stumps, dug back to the bowler, who has an aim at the non-striker's end with Faulkner backing up. He is in, though
slower one outside off, slashes an outside edge down to third man. Good running - two
yorker, swerves in on off, inside-edged onto the pad, as the ball wanders away to the off side
yorker on leg stump, squeezed square through the leg side for a double
another yorker, which is jammed out for one

very full and outside off, shovelled with the bottom hand to wide long-on. Starc and Faulkner push on for the second. Nice, flat throw from the deep to Rizwan who breaks the stumps and catches Starc short
full-toss on off, scooped in front of cover as the leg-side slog goes wrong
very full on middle, whipped or rather toe-ended to short fine leg
a wide to start with, swinging too far down the leg side as Azhar looks to flick
fullish outside off, Azhar plays a checked drive into the gap between cover and mid-off
no swing this time, goes with the angle down the leg side and hits the left-hander's front pad as he misses the flick
this one does swing away in the corridor. No feet from Sharjeel, just a tentative play and miss
another wide. Starc slants this a long way down the leg side. Sharjeel swivels to try and pull, but no way is he meeting that
short, rising over off stump. Not too much room to free his arms through the pull, so he plays a short-arm checked pull into the gap to the right of square leg
this one isn't short enough to pull, hits him on the stomach as he attempts the shot anyway
lovely. Fullish, swinging away on a sixth-stump line, inviting the drive away from the body. Sharjeel plays and misses again. Needs a bigger stride forward to drive those
length ball in the corridor, a bit of away-swerve. Azhar leaves it alone
ooh, this one swings even further, from slightly wider outside off. Azhar pokes at it, playing a half-hearted back-foot punch, and misses by a long way
length ball close to off stump, nicely done. Plays a soft-hands push towards mid-off and calls his partner through for a single
short and wide, was there for the cut, but he is maybe slightly late on it and the ball rises over his top edge
far more controlled this time, chops the ball down to point. This one didn't bounce as much, and the line was a little closer to the batsman
this one isn't quite short enough to cut, and it comes back in late to sneak past the inside edge
full-toss, and that must hurt. Fast, at the batsman, and swinging in late. Looks to flick it hurriedly and only manages an inside-edge onto the inside of his left thigh
low full-toss on off stump, jams his bat down to block to mid-on
another full-toss, low, but this one is way outside off stump. Azhar reaches out, meets it with a horizontal bat, and stabs it to the right of the diving Maxwell at backward point

gone! Full, swinging in, and it's so hard to drag your front leg away from those. He's forced to play across it, misses it by a long way, and he doesn't bother reviewing. I'd like to see ball-tracking anyway - seemed like there was just a bit of a chance it may have swung down the leg side. Nope. Hitting the middle of leg stump, it says
fullish, close to off stump, defended to mid-off, shows the full face
very full, wide of off, opens his bat face to jab it to third man
length ball, was looking for the one that swings away from the line of the stumps, but it doesn't swing and ends up going down the leg side
this one does swing, just a little, starts on a fifth-stump line and Babar leaves it alone
full, close to off stump, Babar shows the full face of his bat to punch down the ground, to the left of mid-on
back of a length, a bit of swing towards middle stump to cramp Sharjeel. Defended back towards the bowler

is that another lbw? Simon Fry says no. Full, and from that angle it needs to be full to get the left-hander. Nope, pitching outside leg and probably missing too. Looks to flick it and the swing beats his edge
full on off stump, jabbed to mid-on

shot! That's a length ball, but he's offered just a bit of width, and he sets himself up on a lovely stable base and lets his arms flow through the line of the ball to send it racing between cover and mid-off
length ball close to off stump, defended into the covers
low full-toss on middle stump, moves his front leg out of the way to account for the swing and brings a straight bat down to clip to the right of mid-on
short, cramps up Sharjeel as he shapes to pull. Only manages a feeble swat to square leg
and again, shortish ball cramping Sharjeel for room. Ends up hitting him on the body as he tries to tuck it into the leg side
And again. Sharjeel is too closed-off against this shortish ball angling into his body, and it ends up hitting him on his uplifted thigh
fullish, close to off stump, pushed into the point region
length ball on off stump, punched to mid-on
length ball on off stump, delivers from slightly wider of the crease, defended back towards the bowler
full, down the leg side. Can't connect with the flick
fullish, close to off stump, defended into the covers
fullish outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
drags his length back slightly, Babar gets forward to defend into the covers
ooh, excellent ball. Full outside off, wider than the previous balls, but not a half-volley. Reaches away from his body to drive and it straightens to take his edge, runs away down to third man
full on off stump, check-driven to the left of mid-off

short, angling into the body, and this time Sharjeel times his swivel to get his body out of the way and bring his bat around to pull to the midwicket boundary. Toe-ended it, but at least he met it with his bat this time
full on off stump, a bit of away swerve, punched back to the bowler
full on off stump, clipped to the right of the diving midwicket fielder
short outside off, maybe not enough width to cut. Jabs at it instead, looking to hit through point or maybe to third man, and the ball bounces extra and beats his edge
full on off stump, driven firmly but too close to mid-off, who stops it with a tumble to his right
back of a length on off stump. Sharjeel plays it with an angled bat and dabs towards short third man
full now, overpitched, and Sharjeel puts it away, meets it with a nice, free swing of his bat to send it running away between cover and cover point
back of a length close to off stump, and that's nicely played, whipped against the angle to the left of long-on
short, wide, slashed away to the left of a desperately diving backward point fielder
short and wide again, beaten this time. May have connected with the cut had he moved his back foot across a little quicker
bouncer over off stump, Sharjeel is beaten for pace as he tries to hook this. Top-edge loops up dangerously but lands a fair distance from the man running towards the boundary from short fine leg
fullish, angling towards middle stump from over the wicket. Sharjeel defends back to the bowler
once again, fullish and attacking the stumps. Sharjeel lets it come on, meets it with soft hands, and drops it into the off side for a quick single
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of mid-off

full on off stump, driven back straight and Cummins asks for a run-out. He thinks he's got a hand on it to deflect the ball into the stumps. Was Babar inside his crease? Let's see what the replays say. Looks like there was the tiniest touch of the fingertip... but Babar has stretched back and made his ground comfortably.
shortish, not enough width to cut, can't play it as square as he'd like, straight to the fielder at cover point
length ball close to off stump, pushed gently towards cover-point, who's right on the edge of the circle, and Sharjeel picks up another sharp single
starts with a short ball on off stump, pulled to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball slanting across the stumps. Wants to drive through cover but the ball doesn't quite come on, and he ends up inside-edging into his pads
back of a length outside off, punched to cover point
back of a length on off stump, opens up a touch to be able to whip this to deep midwicket
full on off and middle, and that's an excellent shot, flicks it in the air, in the gap to the right of midwicket, and beats the fielder running to his left from long-on
back of a length, some inward movement towards off stump to cramp Babar. Wants to punch through the covers, can only play it back to the bowler in the end

ooh. Having brought the previous ball back in, he gets this to straighten. A little fuller, and Babar pushes forward at it without getting a big stride in, and it beats the outside edge of his defensive bat
back of a length, swinging in just a bit towards off stump. Lets it come on and dabs towards point
length ball outside off, and that's a lovely shot, driven on the up between cover point and cover, and Warner chases back from cover and dives full-length to pull it back from the rope
shortish, rising over middle stump. Babar shuffles across to whip it away through square leg
bouncer, Babar ducks under it
short outside off, slapped away to deep point
back of a length on off stump, punched back firmly to the bowler
short outside off, and that's a super shot. Packed off-side field on the 30-yard circle, and he gets on top of the bounce and slaps it away to the left of cover point
back of a length on middle stump, shuffles across to work it to deep square leg
fullish on off stump, gets forward to block to cover
shortish, close to off stump, and that's well played. A whip-pull with front leg raised to send it speeding away to the square leg boundary
oooh, whatashot! Full, angling into off stump, and Babar just meets it with the full face showing and drives to the left of mid-on
short outside off, lets it come on and rolls his wrists over at the top of the bounce to steer it down to third man
shortish on middle stump, Sharjeel works it away through square leg
length ball on off stump, defended into the off side

back of a length on off stump, straightens just a touch. Wanted to work that into the leg side, but checked himself and didn't close his bat face in the end. Adjusted to the movement by playing with a straight bat towards cover
short, angling into off and middle. Hops to get on top of the bounce and defends into the off side
tossed up on middle stump, driven to mid-off
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump. Wants to punch that to long-on but short midwicket moves quickly to intercept
shot! That's a full ball outside off, and he's pretty much square-cut that, picks up two towards deep point
tossed up outside off, gets forward for a checked punch to short cover
short of a length and angling away outside off, 146ks, steered down to third man for a single
dug short and outside off, 140.4ks, Babar camps back and swats it away to Starc running around at deep square leg
short and outside off, bursts off the surface, jumps over Sharjeel's attempted upper-cut
fractionally short and outside off, Sharjeel loves it there. He leans back and scythes a cut to the left of diving backward point. Whistles away to the fence
back of a length and sliding away outside off, Sharjeel rides the bounce and nudges a single down to third man
back of a length and holds its line outside off, crisply punched on the back foot past Maxwell's right at backward point. He dives and takes some pace off the ball
full on middle, no turn, easily driven to long-off
spins into the pads, whipped along the ground to deep square leg
shorter legbreak outside off, Azam moves back and punches it to the left of Zampa
loopier on middle, non-turning ball, bunted to midwicket

chipped just over the head of mid-off.... and rolls away to the boundary. Tossed-up legbreak outside off, dips, creating some distance between the bat and the pitch. Sharjeel goes through with the lofted drive and ends up chipping in the air. He could have been out. Instead, gets a boundary
spinning into the hips, short-arm pulled away to deep square leg
drops it short and outside off, Sharjeel goes back and chops to point
short and outside off again, this is flat-batted away to long-off
tossed up on the pads from around the wicket, nurdled to square leg
whipped off the pads through the vacant spaces at midwicket. There's protection in the deep
full and slides on middle, driven down to long-off. Three half-centuries in a row for Sharjeel
down the track, Azam gets close enough to the pitch and drives a single down to long-on
dragged down on middle, camps back and forces the ball to mid-on
length ball outside off, Babar throws his hands at the ball and inside-edges the ball just past off stump
slides on, flat and outside off, eased down to long-off
fired down the leg side, the ball bobbles out of Wade's gloves, and they sneak across
tossed up full on off, driven to extra cover
nice and full, non-turning break on middle, driven down to long-off
slower legbreak, turns in, nurdled to midwicket with soft hands
looped up outside off, Sharjeel scoops up in the air, in front of long-off
pushed through flatter as Azam comes down the track and works a single to long-on
dropped fractionally short and outside off, Sharjeel is really quick to skip back and put it over midwicket with a pull
short offbreak outside off, goes back and lashes a square-cut to deep point
full and slides across off, driven in the gap at extra cover
short and wide outside off, Sharjeel goes deep in the crease as flat-bats a cut to sweeper on the off side
tossed up on middle and leg spins down the leg side, Sharjeel goes low and paddles it fine of Faulkner, I think, at short fine leg for the century stand
length-ball legbreak, driven to the left of extra cover
slides on flatter and quicker, this time he mis-times a drive straight to extra cover
another quick, flat legbreak, which is slashed away to point
dropped short and wide outside off, Azam is quick to rock back and cut to sweeper
flighted on the leg stump, swept straight to Faulkner at short fine leg
back of a length and slanted in, picked off through midwicket
full and wide outside off, flat-batted away to the right of mid-off
wide of the crease and angles a short ball into a back-foot punch to mid-on
full on off, Azam hangs back, twirls his wrists and flicks smartly through midwicket
slower ball outside off or on off, back of the hand, shovelled away with the bottom hand to long-on
length ball outside off, opens the face, and runs it away towards backward point. You can't take on Maxwell's arm
tossed up very slower through the air on off, 79ks, Sharjeel sizes it up and swings it over midwicket, clears Starc in the deep

Zampa dives to his right and deflects the ball back onto the stumps, appeals, but Babar is in. Tossed-up legbreak, nearly scooped back to the bowler. The ball just dies in front of him. Babar backed up, but is back by the time the bail comes off the groove
change-up, quicker, hurrying ball. Defended
slides on the leg stump, slog-swept away square of short fine leg
shorter legbreak, turns away outside off, Babar goes hard on the cut, loses his shape, and chops the ball square on the off side
Zampa throws it up outside off, Sharjeel takes it on. He opens up his shoulders, swings it mightily across the line and dumps Zampa over the wide long-on fence
back of a length and outside off, front-foot punch to Cooper at mid-off
back of a length and wide outside off, Azam scythes a back-foot cut and finds point
tight line just a shade outside off, opens the face and runs the ball to point. Three dots after a 14-run over
dug short on middle, swatted straight down the ground with a flat bat
very full and wide outside off, Sharjeel crunches a drive on the up to Starc at deep point
back of the hand slower ball outside off, tapped away through point. Just four off the over after 14 off the previous one
legbreak, dragged short and turns outside off, stands tall and punches to long-off
full and straight, Sharjeel plays back and flicks past midwicket's left. Smith chases the ball, slides and tests his ankle out
another shorter legbreak outside off, back-foot force to deep point
lobbed up outside off, turns away, Sharjeel reads the wrong'un. The length was short, which helped Sharjeel, and he punched to long-off on the back foot
sliding into the leg stump, punched down to long-on
pushed through flat on middle and leg, not much turn, camps back and punchily blocks back to Zampa
pitched up and angling away outside off, gets forward and drives it back to the bowler
yorker, slanting away outside off, Babar can't jam it out
inswinging yorker on middle and leg, squirted to mid-on

Starc returns and bounces out Sharjeel. Wade sensibly moves to his right and tracks down the skier with the big gloves. Starc runs in hard and hits the deck harder. Rapid chest-high short delivery just outside off. Sharjeel is late onto the hook and skies a catch to Wade
full and angling away, driven past Starc's right to mid-on
quick lifter on the leg stump, Azam watches it carefully and ducks under it. Only nine off the last three overs. Sharjeel fell to the scoreboard pressure
Zampa hangs it up in the air, full on middle, pushed back down the pitch
might have been a googly, zips in, inside-edged onto the pad, Azam weathers the lbw appeal
short and wide outside off, cracked on the back foot to sweeper for a fifty
non-turning legbreak, which is calmly push-driven to long-off on the front foot
looped up on middle, chipped to long-off
short legbreak, turns away outside off, the batsman gets on top of it and flays a cut to deep point
nice and full on off, 145.3ks, defended
ripping yorker on off, 146.6ks, squeezed back to the bowler, who has an aim at the stumps

good length and slanting away outside off, 147.4ks, Hafeez drives away from the body and sends an outside edge flying to the left of Smith. Starc comes back and what does he do? Takes two wickets in space of six balls and jolts the chase
back of a length on middle, 145.9ks, played back to the bowler
slightly overpitched and outside off, Malik leans into a drive and finds extra cover
bouncer, angling away outside off, Malik drops his wrists on it
tossed up on middle, full, Babar stays leg-side of the ball and drives it inside-out over extra cover. Beats long-off in the deep. Excellent execution
full and straight on middle, gets forward and pushes it back to Zampa
down the track and mis-times a drive to cover
length-ball legbreak outside off. Malik goes back and guides through point
slides on, very full on middle, driven down to long-off on the front foot
turning legbreak outside off, Malik gropes outside off with no feet and watches the ball pass the outside edge
full and outside off, Azam opens the face of the bat and drives it to the left of sweeper cover. Handscomb runs across and lets it the ball through to the boundary
very full and just a shade outside leg, misses the pad, misses leg stump. Wide
back of a length and outside off, carves a drive to Handscomb, who mops it up in the deep
very full and angling away outside off, 145.9ks, squeezes a drive to Cummins at extra cover
short on leg stump, Azam shuffles inside the line and just deflects the ball down to fine leg
short on middle, hops and fends the ball through square leg. Hares back for the second

full and angling away outside off, drives in front of mid-off, and sets off does Malik. Warner is on the prowl, swoops down on the ball, diving forward, but can't throw the stumps down at the non-striker's end
short of a length and outside off, Malik goes back, rides the bounce and punches to deep point
short on off, hops and deflects the ball behind square on the off side
shot. Babar sends the white ball sailing over mid-on who is inside the circle. Length and outside off, lofts it over the in-field with authority
short and outside off, shuffles across off and pulls to deep square leg
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and dabs the ball to the right of Smith at wide slip
big short ball outside off, a bit too quick for Malik. He hooks and top-edges it over the head of Wade behind the stumps
full on the stumps, chips a drive in front of Starc at mid-on
bouncer, flies off the surface, over the upright batsman. Wide
nice and full outside off, gets forward, meets the pitch and drives in the direction of Handscomb at sweeper
back of a length on middle, camps back and flicks through the midwicket region. Pakistan pass David Warner's 179
length ball outside off, 146.4ks, opens the face and glides down to third man

appeal for caught behind? Did that loop off the arm or glove behind to Smith running back and across to his right at wide slip. Skiddy short ball, leaps off the surface, angled in, Malik was probably not sure whether to duck or fend. In the end, he does a bit of both, and also takes his eyes off the ball. The ball pings his forearm and loops over to slip. Malik clutches his wrist in pain. Australia did well not to review it. The physio is out to attend to Malik

short of a length and angled in, Umar jumps off the ground and fends it just beside the pitch on the leg side. Cummins runs in and across to his right, attacks the ball, picks it and aims a throw at the striker's end. Umar, who was searching for a risky single - there wasn't a single there actually - spins back and survives. Babar does not move. A direct hit could have had him
leg-side ball, deflected to long leg
length and outside off, helped down to third man
back of a length and outside off, punched on the up, straight to short extra cover
chest-high short ball outside off, swivels on the back foot, rides the bounce. Pulls to long leg
takes a short ball from outside off and swats it away to deep midwicket on the back foot
full on middle and leg, shuffles across off and clips it away to the right of deep square leg
length ball, kicks up outside off, Umar has a loose waft away from the body and does not make contact. His feet went nowhere
short and outside off, rolls his wrists and pulls a single to long leg
just short of a good length and outside off, slower one, angled down to third man
length and outside off, opens the face, and guides past backward point to third man
short and down leg, ducks under it. Wide called
Babar shuffles across off, meets a hip-high short ball on middle, not sure if he inside-edged it onto the thigh
short of a length and outside off, swatted away to the left of deep midwicket
back of a length, skids on, beats the batsman's attempt to flick to leg and raps the thigh
length ball on middle, slower, Umar eyes a leg-side pick up and is hit on the box
back of a length and outside off, stands up tall and punches to sweeper cover
short of a length and outside off, leans back and cuts to the right of third man
full on middle and leg, picked up and flicked in the air over backward square leg
length ball outside off, chipped in the air straight down the ground
just short of a good length on off, hops and chops to point
length and outside off, deftly run down to third man
high bouncer outside off, the batsman drops his wrists on it. Not a wide. Cummins gets away
back of a length and outside off, 143ks, guided down to third man for one more
short on middle, 146ks, hustles the batsman for pace. More of a short-arm flap than a short-arm pull. The ball goes only as far as midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away into the midwicket region
slower ball, full on off stump, driven with a lot of power but hit straight to mid-off
shortish, too much width, slapped away to the point boundary and Babar moves into the 90s
short again, down the leg side this time, and that's terrible bowling with fine leg in the circle. Whip-pulled away to the left of the fielder and it races for another four
loopy slower ball wide of off stump, and that's superbly played by Babar, just reaches out and meets it with an open bat face to steer it to the right of backward point
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and pushes into the point region to move to 99
length ball, wide of off, well wide in fact. Reaches out to drive and plays and misses. Called wide, and on replay it's clear it was wide of the tramline

there's the hundred, it's been a superb innings so far. Back of a length on off stump, and he tucks it quietly through square leg to pick up one. Not too much of a celebration. Takes his helmet off, raises his bat to the crowd, hugs his cousin at the other end, and gets back to business
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists to play that to mid-on
fullish, and he gets this to swing away from a fifth-stump line to beat Babar's attempted on-the-up drive

there's that swing again, from the stumps this time, and Hazlewood's taken the big wicket. Looks to play a pick-up shot over mid-on, and that late swing meant he only got the leading edge to it, and the ball ballooned up for a simple catch to mid-on. An excellent delivery to end an excellent innings
short, very wide outside off. Akmal reaches out to cut but can't connect
fullish outside off, defended to point
back of a length on leg stump, worked away to deep midwicket
back of a length, slanted across the right-hander. Akmal lets it come on and dabs to backward point
back of a length on off stump, came back in slightly to cramp Akmal. Wanted to punch that through the covers, in the end he can only jam down his bat and squeeze it to backward point
length ball on middle stump, slogged away, on the bounce, to deep midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, opens his bat face to stab it down to third man

full on off stump, and that's dropped. Long-on was back, Akmal decided to take him on, and didn't get as much pace onto the bat as he'd have liked. Scooped it up, and Handscomb, running to his left and reaching overhead, got both hands to the ball but couldn't hold on
on the pads, clipped away through square leg
full, angling down leg. Rizwan can't connect with the flick
fullish, angling into off stump, driven firmly, beats cover diving to his right, but can't beat Warner, running to his left from mid-on
short, angling into the body, and that's excellent, swivelled to pull it from just in front of his chest, finds the gap between deep midwicket and long leg
ooh, what a follow-up. Back of a length, angling into off stump, straightening late. Opens up Akmal and beats his outside edge as he looks to defend, feet rooted to the spot
fullish on off stump, and that's a safe shot now that mid-on and midwicket are in the circle. Doesn't really middle this slog, but gets it safely over the gap between the two fielders

shot! That's a length ball angling into off stump, nothing too wrong with it, considering the movement he's getting. Brings his bottom hand into play and whips it wristily over the gap to mid-on's left
length ball on off stump, punched back to the bowler, who sees Akmal out of his crease and fires a throw that narrowly misses off stump
short, rising ball angling into the body. Jumps to ride the bounce and knocks it down into the leg side with soft hands
slower ball outside off, Akmal slogs and misses
full, a little wider outside off, Akmal slices under the ball, halfway deliberately, to send it soaring into the air over the point region and it lands in the big gap to the right of third man
short outside off, looks like another slower ball. Akmal waits this time before dabbing it down to third man
bouncer, difficult one for Rizwan to negotiate, he has to hook from over his right shoulder. Top-edges and it loops over the keeper and lands in the gap to the right of long leg

short outside off, and that's timed too well for Rizwan's liking. Goes for the slash, ends up slicing under the ball, and does it carry to Starc diving forward from third man? He himself isn't sure. They're checking upstairs now... Soft signal is out. Looks like he's taken it cleanly. Yup, out, and is that it for Pakistan?
length ball slanting away from off stump. Amir looks for the drive through cover, doesn't get forward quickly enough and he's comfortably beaten
this one's shorter, a little wider. Amir throws his bat at it but doesn't move his feet at all. Beaten again
shortish outside off, steered down to third man
back of a length outside off, sliced to third man
length ball close to off stump, driven through point with a slightly open face
back of a length outside off, lets it come on and dabs to third man
slower bouncer outside off, Akmal can't connect with the hook
back of a length outside off, another slower ball. This time Akmal holds his shape nicely, and swats it away to the wide long-on boundary
looks for the wide yorker, ends up bowling a fast, low, wide full-toss. Akmal uses the pace well, slices under it with an open face to send it screaming to the left of third man
This time he gets the wide yorker more or less on target. Akmal looks to reach out and squeeze it away, can't connect
slower full-toss on off stump, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle stump, defended to cover
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover

fullish on off stump, clears his front leg to slog, ends up dragging it along the ground to mid-on. An inaccurate shy at the bowler's end - from Cummins - gifts an overthrow, though Amir was out if he'd hit
slower length ball on middle and off. Looks to make room to slap through the off side, can't get it past cover
now he middles one. Fullish on middle stump, makes himself room again and lifts it over extra-cover
full on leg stump, driven with a lot of effort but straight to mid-on

shortish now, looks like another slower ball. Amir clears his front leg early, but then spots the change-up and holds his shape, and that allows him to time his swat over midwicket as sweetly as possible
slower ball, full and wide, and Akmal smacks it over mid-off. Picked his spot, and got exactly the delivery he needed. Cleared his front leg to make himself extra swinging room
yorker on off stump, jabbed away to backward point and he wants a single. He's nearly halfway down the pitch before Amir sends him back. Makes his ground safely enough in the end
looks for the wide yorker, Akmal goes deep in his crease and across with his back foot to try and slap it through point, only manages a top-edge to the keeper
full, angling down leg. Can't connect with the flick and the ball hits him on the pad
that's the bouncer angled across Amir, and it's well played, kept his eye on it and then helped it over the keeper and slip, down to third man
full on off stump, driven crisply to sweeper cover
slower ball, leg-stumpish. Clears his front leg and gets down on one knee to swipe it through backward square leg
another slower ball, wide outside the left-hander's off stump. Amir slogs and misses
loopy slower ball on middle stump, Amir makes room and slices it away to the left of short third man

back of a length slower ball on off stump. Amir makes room to slog, ends up hitting the high part of his bat and looping high in the air. Maxwell, the fielder at cover, runs in from the 30-yard circle and completes a simple catch
slower ball wide of off, Wahab slashes and misses. Shamsuddin signals wide
another wide slower ball, fuller this time, slashed to the left of deep point
full on off stump, clears his front leg to flat-bat to long-off
middle-stump yorker, jams his bat down to dig it out
full outside off. Wahab goes for the flashing drive, and can't connect
low full-toss, almost hits the base of off stump on the full after Wahab clears his front leg and misses an ambitious drive
very full outside off, Wahab plays and misses
full outside off, sliced in the air, on the bounce, to the right of third man
full-toss outside off, and Hasan is off the mark with a nervy push that he edges. Bounces as it approaches Wade, and it hits his pad and runs away towards third man
slower ball at the batsman's legs. Gets down on one knee and slogs it away through square leg
length ball on middle stump, clipped to short fine leg
short on off stump, pulled in the air, one-bounce, to the right of long-on
loopy slower ball, full on off stump, pushed to mid-off
another slower ball, another full-blooded Wahab swipe, rolls along down to backward square leg
another slower ball. This time Hasan slogs, slices it high in the air, drops into the vacant mid-off region
full, slanting down leg. Misses the flick and it ricochets into the leg side off the pad
full on middle stump, Wahab clears his front leg and miscues a pick-up shot over mid-on. Just about clears the fielder
fullish on off stump, clears his front leg again, and this time meets it with a straight bat, shovels it back over the bowler's head
full-toss outside off, Wahab slices it over cover point, and Zampa, running in from the boundary and diving forward, gets both hands to it and spills it.
what is happening here? Full toss on off stump, looks to push towards mid-on and gets a leading edge that loops over short cover, to his left. Starc is furious
full outside off, Wahab has a big swing at it, and misses
short ball, slides on with the angle to hit the batsman's thigh after he misses the pull
flighted outside off, Hasan goes for the slog-sweep and clears Maxwell, jumping to his right at the deep midwicket boundary
down the track now, chips it on the bounce to sweeper cover
dangled up slow outside off, Wahab is too early into his slog-sweep, can't connect
this time it's too full for the slog-sweep, bottom-edges it to short fine leg
down the track comes Hasan, and Pakistan are eight down. Slowed it down, the tailender was through his slog well before it arrived, and then it spun away and offered Wade a simple stumping

and that is that. Yorker on middle stump, Wahab makes room to try and drive that through the covers, and he misses. The bails light up, to signal a 57-run win for Australia. Shoaib Malik, who retired hurt after being hit on the forearm, won't come out to resume his innings
